ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Relationship to Subject
Notes: 4= Biological mother; 5= Biological Father; 6= Non-biological female caregiver; 7= Non-biological male caregiver

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Using short phrases - Is she/he now able to talk using short phrases or sentences? If no, skip to Question 8
Take turns in conversation - Can you have a to-and-fro conversation with her/him that involves taking turns or building on what you have said?

Repetition of odd phrases - Has she/he ever used odd phrases or say the same thing over and over in almost exactly the same way (either phrases that she/he hears other people use or ones that she/he makes up)?

Socially inappropriate questions or statements - Has she/he ever used socially inappropriate questions or statements? For example, has she/he regularly asked personal questions or make personal comments at awkward times?
Mixed up use of pronouns - Has she/he ever got her/his pronouns mixed up (e.g. saying you or she/he for I)?

Use of made up words or metaphors - Has she/he ever used words that she/he seemed to have invented or made up herself/himself; put things in odd, indirect ways; or used metaphorical ways of saying things (e.g. saying hot rain for steam)?
Repetition of exactly the same phrases - Has she/he ever said the same thing over and over in exactly the same way or insist that you say the same thing over and over again?
Rituals - Has she/he ever had things that she/he seemed to have to do in a very particular way or order or rituals that she/he insists that you go through?
Inappropriate facial expressions - Has her/his facial expression usually seemed appropriate to the particular situation, as far as you can tell?

Use of parents hand like a tool - Has she/he ever used your hand like a tool or as if it were part of her/his own body (e.g. pointing with your finger, putting your hand on a doorknob to get you to open the door)?
Odd interests - Has she/he ever had any interests that preoccupy her/him and might seemed odd to other people (e.g. traffic lights, drainpipes, timetables)?

Interest in part of toy or object rather than in whole object - Has she/he ever seemed to be more interested in parts of a toy or an object (e.g. spinning the wheels of a car), rather than in using the objects as it was intended?

Unusually intense special interests - Has she/he ever had any special interests that are unusual in their intensity but otherwise appropriate for her/his age and peer group (e.g. trains or dinosaurs)?
Interest in sight, feel, sound, taste or smell of things or people - Has she/he ever seemed to be unusually interested in the sight, feel, sound, taste, or smell of things or people?
Mannerisms - Has she/he ever had any mannerisms or odd ways of moving her/his hands or fingers, such as flapping or moving her/his fingers in front of her/his eyes?
Complicated movements of whole body - Has she/he ever had any complicated movements of her/his whole body, such as spinning or repeatedly bouncing up and down?
Deliberate self-injury - Has she/he ever injured herself/himself deliberately, such as biting her/his arm or banging her/his head?
Need to carry around objects other than a soft toy or blanket - Has she/he ever had any objects (other than a soft toy or comfort blanket) that she/he had to carry around?
Having any particular friends or a best friend - Does she/he ever have any particular friends or a best friend?
Talking with parent just to be friendly rather than to get something - Did she/he ever talk to you just to be friendly (rather than to get something)?
Spontaneously coping what other people are doing - Did she/he ever spontaneously copy you (or other people) or what you are doing (such as vacuuming, gardening, or mending things)?
Spontaneously pointing at things just to show them - Did she/he ever spontaneously point at things around her/him just to show you things (not because she/he wants them)?
Gestures to get things except pointing or pulling  hand - Did she/he ever use gestures, other than pointing or pulling your hand, to let you know what she/he wants?
Nodding head to indicate yes - Did she/he nod her/his head to indicate yes?
Shaking head to indicate no - Did she/he shake her/his head to indicate no?
Looking directly in the face - Did she/he usually look at you directly in the face when doing things with you or talking with you?
Smiling back when smiled at - Did she/he smile back if someone smiles at her/him?
Showing things to get parents attention - Did she/he ever show you things that interest her/him to engage your attention?
Offering to share things other than food - Did she/he ever offer to share things other than food with you?
Wanting to be joined in something - Did she/he ever seemed to want you to join in her/his enjoyment of something?
Trying to comfort a hurt or sad parent - Did she/he ever try to comfort you if you are sad or hurt?
Asking for help to get something - If she/he wanted something or wants help, did she/he look at you and use gestures with sounds or words to get your attention?
Normal range of facial expressions - Did she/he show a normal range of facial expressions?
Spontaneously joining in social games - Did she/he ever spontaneously join in and try to copy the actions in social games, such as The Mulberry Bush or London Bridge is Falling Down?
Playing any pretend or make-believe games - Did she/he play any pretend or make-believe games?
Interest in other children the same age - Did she/he seem interested in other children of approximately the same age whom she/he does not know?
Positive response when approached by another child - Did she/he respond positively when another child approaches her/him?
Attentive when talked to - If you come into a room and started talking to her/him without calling her/his name, did she/he usually look up and pay attention to you?
Imaginative pretend games - Did she/he ever play imaginative games with another child in such a way that you can tell that each child understands what the other is pretending?
Playing cooperatively - Did she/he play cooperatively in games that need some form of joining in with a group of other children, such as hide-and-seek or ball games?
scq subtotal items 1-19
Subtotal Items 1-19: Yes Responses
subtotals for scq 3
scq subtotal 4
SCQ total score
Type of event (Pre-Test or Post-Test)
Validity of data
Notes: 0= raw; 1 = Valid or clean; 2 = Question validity; 3 = Invalid data; 4 = Not answered; 999= missing
